meanings.definition: The act of making something routine or habitual.
meanings.sent1: Her routinizations of daily tasks helped her stay organized.
meanings.sent2: The routinizations of his morning routine included brushing his teeth and making coffee.
meanings.sent3: His routinizations of always wearing mismatched socks made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The routinizations of the factory were like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The routinizations of watering the plants every morning became second nature to her.

meanings.definition: The process of establishing a routine or set of procedures.
meanings.sent1: The routinizations of setting up the new system took weeks to complete.
meanings.sent2: In the office, routinizations were put in place to streamline the workflow.
meanings.sent3: The routinizations of organizing his desk involved color-coding everything.
meanings.sent4: The routinizations of planning the event were meticulous and detailed.
meanings.sent5: Her routinizations of meal prepping on Sundays saved her time during the week.
